ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Building is a type of Product_view_definition that is a definition of a man-made structure erected to house, enclose, protect, or serve one or more human enterprises or endeavors.
A Building shall be owned by one Person_in_organization or one Organization.
A Building shall contain at least a building section. Information about life-cycle phase addressed by the definition of the building can be provided within the inherited attributes initial_context and additional_contexts.
A Building shall be referred to by a Organization_or_person_in_organization_assignment that has role 'owner'.
A Building shall be associated with at least a Building_section through instances of View_definition_relationship.

A Building_level is a part of a Building that consists of one or more areas accessible through primarily horizontal access paths.
A Building_level may be a Sublevel or may have Sublevel instances. Buildings are often structured into building levels. Building items such as spaces, walls, building services equipment are frequently assigned to building levels. Other building items such as chimneys and elevator compartments may cut accross building levels and may not be assigned to building levels.
A Building_level_assignment is the assignment of a Building_level to instances.
The Building_level that is assigned with a .
The to which the Building_level is assigned.

A Building_section is a type of Product_view_definition that identifies a logical section in a Building. Logical segments of a building are defined based on local coordinate systems for functional or definitional convenience.
Buildings are commonly broken down, during design, in individual structures that are integrated at a later point in time. Wings of an hospital, a library or an office complex are examples of building sections.
A Building_section shall be the related_view of exactly one View_definition_relationship whose relating_view identifies the Building that contains the considered building section.

An Item_assembly is a type of Product_view_definition that defines a view of an assembly of instances or Item_assembly instances. The components are combined to form a more complex or larger object. Trusses and frames are typical element assemblies for structural elements. A pipeline is a typical example of an element assembly for building services equipment.
As subtype of Product_view_definition, an Item_assembly defines a view of a version of a Product. Where applicable, the category of that product shall be taken among the categories:
roof: The covering or upper part of a building that has a primary function of protecting the building from weather;
stairway: One or more flights of stairs used to pass from one floor of a building to another; The flights of stairs are often separated by landings and the stairway includes the supporting structure.
vertical passage enclosure: The structure that surrounds, frames, or encloses a vertical opening through the floors of a building.
The set of instances of Assembly_component_relationship in which the Item_assembly plays the role of relating_view and that identify the components of the Item_assembly.
component_relationships shall only contain elements whose type is one of the types listed in assembly_item type.
The item_in_proximity specifies the that are near another .
The item specifies the near which another is positioned.
The relationship_type specifies a descriptive label of proximity. The value is either user defined or predefined.
A Sublevel is a type of Building_level that is a constituent of another Building_level.
The belongs_to specifies the Building_level of which the Sublevel is a part.
